TopicTitle: The Supermoon Total Eclipse - Who Watched It?

Articles.Content:
So it's now a little after 04:00 here in the UK and I'm still up (no I don't have work tomorrow muahaha!), partly watching the eclipse unfold, and partly flying long boring flights around Kerbin in my never-ending career.

So, who else saw it with their own eyes? And who tried all night to catch a tiny moment thru the clouds? And whether you caught a glimpse or not, what did you think, worth the effort to see something that probably won't recur more than 3 times in your life?

Tell me all about it!

Very nice from Northern France with a lot of stars in the sky !

But hard to catch with a camera, 200mm lens, 2.8, 1/4sec.
I'm in California, and it's not over yet. It's amazing.
Yup. Too pictures here on the west coast. Need to get them off digi carmra. Saw the start on a live stream saw the Bloood Moon from my house.

I'm in California, and it's not over yet. It's amazing.

Lol, it's not over anywhere yet! Same moon

Well, unless the moon's set now maybe...
Nope... Too cloudy.

Clouds to the east.

Happy landings!
I reported in for the viewing.
The clouds here in Houston were their usual shade of depression.

Overcast in T.O. region, so no dice.

I had my old 40D ready with a 300mm (480 after crop factor; it's a cheapy Sigma, but it gets the job done) lens for it too...

Had wonderful clear skies for it - unfortunately, Britain. By 3am mist had rolled in and I couldn't see anything.

No clouds, just light pollution godamnit.
Had a campfire while looking for it. Mostly clouded out, but we got a few looks at it in some breaks.
Took this picture at Salt Lake City.
Watched it with the lover, her best friend, and her best friend's kid. Was a great night.
A friend brought over a telescope and I saw it through some good magnification. Had some intermittent cloud cover but it was great viewing overall!

I saw it here in UK. Set alarm for 3:30 to get the middle bit. Good to see it and pleased I made the effort. Back to bed for 4:30, work alarm goes off at 6:00, so a bit more dopey than usual atm. Got some photos, most rubbish, but some look ok at a glance, just need to transfer from camera and check them out properly.
Viewed it in a remote field in the River Valley in Edmonton Alberta, and through the University's observatory! T'was quite the sight!
I got a kinda smudgy glimpse of of it through some clouds. Shame it isn't as easy as uninstalling EVE to get rid of those fluffy devils.
If I wasn't down for a 15 hour shift today, I would've! I like all the pictures though guys.
Overcast in East Texas. No Joy.

nope. had to get up work work early today and I was tired as hell yesterday so no dice.

I love space, I really do, but not enough to fall asleep at my desk at work.

I'll catch the next one in 2033. that one starts at a more reasonable hour where I live

*reads thread

*remembers that he completely forgot

*kries in korner
It was raining where I was. Also I think it hasn't started yet for me.

I didn't plan on it, but woke up at the right time even without setting an alarm.

Still, no luck, as the weather was hazy here in Linz/Austria, so I just went back to bed...
Where's the option for "I live on the wrong half of the world"?
